page.title: 19Peat cutting at Kylesku
page.content: After the last frost of the year the peat cutting begins. The first stage is to take off a strip of turf about 20cm wide and the length of the bank. This has to be done carefully so that the turf can be replaced when the cutting is finished. The next-day the real peat cutting starts. Two people are required, one to cut the peats, using a tusk,the other to throw the peats onto the bank in neat lines where they are left to dry. The peats are usualy about 45cm long, 20cm broad and 5 cm wide. About two weeks later the peats are lifted and stacked into piles of five, wet side up. Later the piles will be built into a larger stack and finally taken home. Then comes the most enjoyable part _ sitting in front of a warm peat fire on a cold winter's night.
